abstracts.cdata!:
The Industrial Energy Efficiency Project
            aims to: (a) reduce energy consumption per unit of output in
            economically and financially viable industrial and power
            plants, thereby reinforcing the overall industrial sector
            objectives of higher efficiency and increased
            competitiveness. It also seeks to (b) promote development of
            appropriate policies, technologies and institutional
            framework to further strengthen the country's energy
            rationalization program. The project consists of two
            components: (a) a line of credit for financing about 50
            energy conservation subprojects; and (b) technical
            assistance for further strengthening of EMU and improving
            appraisal capability of Agrani Bank for energy conservation subprojects.
